task.title: Adding a delegate host using a file

taskbody.context: Use this procedure to add a delegate host to a resource pool by using a key bundle file.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Create a new resource pool, if desired.

substep.cmd: Display the names of the existing resource pools.

substep.stepxmp: Replace Resource-Pool with the name of a new resource pool: serviced pool add Resource-Pool

step.cmd: Add a delegate host to a resource pool.
step.info: You can use a hostname or an IP address to identify a cluster host. If you use a hostname, all of the hosts in your cluster must be able to resolve it, either through an entry in /etc/hosts or through a nameserver on the network.
step.stepxmp: Replace Hostname-Or-IP with the hostname or IP address of a delegate host, and replace Resource-Pool with the name of a resource pool: serviced host add Hostname-Or-IP:4979 Resource-Pool
step.stepresult: The command creates a unique key bundle file in the local directory.

step.cmd: Use a file transfer utility such as scp to copy the key bundle file to the delegate host.
step.info: Once copied to the delegate host, the key bundle file is not needed on the master host and can be deleted.

step.cmd: Log in to the delegate host .

step.stepxmp: Replace Key-Bundle-Path with the pathname of the key bundle file: serviced host register Key-Bundle-Path

step.info: The file is no longer needed on the delegate host.
step.stepxmp: Replace Key-Bundle-Path with the pathname of the key bundle file: rm Key-Bundle-Path
